column1: Novy Urengoy(New Urengoy) (Russian: Но́вый Уренго́й) is a city in Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug
column5: 235 (1989 Census). It is the second largest city in the autonomous okrug after Noyabrsk.

column1: == History ==
It was founded in 1975 after the discovery of the Urengoy gas field
column2: one of the largest in Russia. Town status was granted to it in 1980.

column1: == Administrative and municipal status ==
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the city of okrug significance of Novy Urengoy—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the city of okrug significance of Novy Urengoy is incorporated as Novy Urengoy Urban Okrug.

column1: == Climate ==
Novy Urengoy has a subarctic climate (Köppen climate classification Dfc). Winters are severely cold and long with average temperatures from −30 °C (−22 °F) to −22 °C (−8 °F) in January
column2: while summers are mild and brief with average temperatures from +10 °C (50 °F) to +18 °C (64 °F) in July. Precipitation is moderate
column3: and is somewhat higher in summer than at other times of the year.

column1: == Economy ==
A major industry of the city is oil and gas production
column2: with one of the largest gas fields in the world in the area and substantial prospects for further exploration. Government owned company Gazprom is the main local employer.

column1: === Transportation ===
The city is situated on the Tyumen–Novy Urengoy railway line. Traveling north from Tyumen
column2: Novy Urengoy is the last station of significance. Noyabrsk is the previous station of significance.

column1: Novy Urengoy is along the Salekhard–Igarka Railway
column2: "Dead Road ".  Extending from Novy Urengoy to Stary Nadym is one section of the Railway of Death that is used as an important freight railway.

column1: The city is served by the Novy Urengoy Airport.
== Sports ==
Fakel is a men's volleyball team competing in the Russian Volleyball Super League and playing at the Gazodobytchik Sports Center. In the 2008-09 season they finished third in the competition
column2: behind Zenit Kazan and Iskra Odintsovo.
